p: A group of 12 pregnant women with a confirmed diagnosis for SARS-CoV were analyzed, aged 27–44 years in Hong Kong. All patients had a high fever for two to nine days and the majority had chills, stiffness, malaise, and myalgia. In addition, all developed a status of lymphopenia (<10⁹ cell/L) and lung problems, slightly elevated lactate dehydrogenase (41.6 %), and aminotransferase (33.3 %), and did not present pneumonia. Half of the patients (50 %) required care in the ICU due to the decreased blood flow saturation and part of the group needed mechanical ventilation (33.3 %) [ 2].
